hero.headline: AI-Powered Document Processing for Medical Malpractice Litigation
hero.subheadline: Medical malpractice cases demand comprehensive analysis of voluminous medical records, expert depositions, and clinical documentation. Dodonai helps medmal attorneys organize, summarize, and analyze case documents in minutes instead of weeks.

sections.heading: The Discovery Challenge in Medical Malpractice Cases
paragraphs: Medical malpractice litigation involves some of the most document-intensive discovery in all of civil practice. A single case can generate thousands of pages of hospital records, physician notes, lab results, imaging reports, pharmacy records, and nursing documentation spanning years of treatment. The sheer volume makes it easy to miss critical details that could make or break a case.

Beyond the volume, medmal discovery presents unique complexity. Your team needs to understand the standard of care for the relevant specialty, identify deviations from that standard, and trace a causal chain from the provider's actions to the patient's harm. Doing this manually requires reading every page, cross-referencing providers and dates, and building a coherent timeline from records that often arrive disorganized and out of order.

AI document processing tools like Dodonai address both the volume and complexity challenges. The software extracts key medical events, organizes them chronologically, and produces {{link:/ai-medical-record-summaries-chronologies/|detailed medical chronologies}} with source-page citations. This gives your team a structured foundation for identifying the standard of care issues and causation evidence that drive medical malpractice claims.

With organized chronologies and {{link:/deposition-summary-software/|deposition summaries}} generated in minutes rather than weeks, your attorneys can focus on the medical and legal analysis that determines case outcomes, rather than spending their time on document organization.

faq.question: How does Dodonai help with medical malpractice case preparation?
faq.answer: Dodonai processes voluminous medical records and deposition transcripts, producing organized chronologies and summaries in minutes. This structured output helps your team identify standard of care deviations, trace causation, and prepare for expert and party depositions without spending days or weeks reading through raw records.

faq.question: Can Dodonai handle records from multiple hospitals and specialists?
faq.answer: Yes. You can upload records from multiple providers, and Dodonai will extract and organize the information into a unified, date-ordered chronology. The interactive viewer allows you to filter by provider, so you can isolate a specific physician's treatment decisions when preparing for a targeted deposition or building your standard of care argument.

faq.question: How accurate are the AI-generated medical chronologies?
faq.answer: Dodonai's chronologies include source-page citations for every entry, so your team can verify any extracted data point against the original record. We recommend that attorneys or qualified reviewers confirm key findings, just as they would with a chronology prepared by a nurse reviewer or paralegal. Read more about {{link:/blog/understanding-medical-chronology-clear-actionable-timelines/|building actionable medical chronologies}}.

faq.question: Can I use Dodonai to prepare exhibits for expert witnesses?
faq.answer: Yes. The chronologies and summaries Dodonai produces are designed to be shared with expert witnesses as organized reference documents. Instead of sending an expert thousands of pages of raw records, you can provide a structured timeline that helps them focus their review on the clinically relevant events.

faq.question: Is Dodonai secure enough for medical malpractice records?
faq.answer: Dodonai is HIPAA compliant with signed Business Associate Agreements and SOC 2 Type II certified. All documents are encrypted with AES-256 in transit and at rest. Your data is never used to train AI models, and you control when your data is deleted.

faq.question: How does AI document processing reduce costs for medmal firms?
faq.answer: Medical malpractice firms often spend thousands of dollars per case on outsourced record review and deposition summary services. Dodonai plans start at $30 per month for up to 200 pages, and the Pro plan handles 5,000 pages at $100 per month. For firms managing multiple active medmal cases, this represents substantial savings compared to per-page vendor pricing.
